I'd highly recommend "Frankenweenie" if you're in the mood for a heartwarming computer animation movie. This film tells the story of a young boy who brings his beloved dog back from the dead through science, featuring an excellent cast including Martin Short and Catherine O'Hara.

If you fancy a more action-packed adventure, "Thunderbirds" (2004) might be right up your alley. This film follows the Tracy family as they save the day with their high-tech equipment, starring Brady Corbet, Philip Winchester, and Sophia Myles. Enjoy the ride!

"Apocalypse Now tells a story set during the Vietnam War, which is similar to Schindler's List in that they both explore themes of conflict and morality. In Schindler's List, Liam Neeson portrays Oskar Schindler, an entrepreneur who saves hundreds of Jews during the Holocaust. It's a powerful and moving film that I highly recommend."

"If you're interested in another epic war drama, Doctor Zhivago might be up your alley as well. Set against the backdrop of the Russian Revolution, it follows the life of a physician who falls in love amidst hardship and political turmoil. Starring Julie Christie and Omar Sharif, it's a masterpiece that showcases romance, politics, and war beautifully."
